intro: Vouacapoua amazonum, commonly known as the "Amazonian rosewood," is a large tree native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its thick, aromatic wood and striking red flowers. The plant has compound leaves with long, narrow leaflets and produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in the understory of dense rainforest canopies. Due to its valuable wood, it is also considered an endangered species in its native habitat.
